intro: Cryptocarpha spathulata, commonly known as broadleaf cryptocarpha, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are broad and oval, with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Cryptocarpha spathulata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats.
